column4: 7D and Red are all excellent low budget options. But be careful with Canons if you're thinking theatrical distribution.

text: stabilization? @jessemore Nothing. Hand held. Get the 7D heavy enough and it becomes stable. But also crazy frenetic movement on this.

column4: Canon or Zeiss. In that order. Lenses w/ external iris preferable.

text: Day 1. Done. MX is a fine machine. Color grading - check. It's mine to fuck up.
Train departs tomorrow. 29 days downtown LA on the Red One MX. If you don't get nervous before day one you're phoning it in.
@BrentwGraham word. I hope all of your producer friends are listening.
RT @BrentwGraham: @ThatKevinSmith I wanna work with @ThatDavidKlein !!!
@HamiltonSeen not sure. have seen footage but haven't actually shot with the Alexa. Need to do my own side by each comparison.
@jeremygaffer the WHOLE world? wow. thanks
column4: cuz. get some rest and remember "WE are the train - THEY are the hobos"

text: @NothingClean Thanks. I stand behind the look of that film. Personal favorite is still Zack & Miri.
Also showed MX footage to @thatkevinsmith projected in 4k and he seemed to dig.
Red One MX test footage = sexy and clean like @jeremygaffer. I'm a fan. Of our test footage and of @jeremygaffer.
getting my grubby mits on Red MX footage in the Lustre today. 4k - 3k - 2k test.
Red One MX test went well. Will have my hands on the footage in Lustre Thursday.
@GardnerM85 need to do my own side by side testing. But Alexa dynamic range and resolution is impressive.
First glance - Arri Alexa footage is pretty sexy.
Looking at Arri Alexa footage this evening. Testing the Red MX sensor tomorrow for upcoming feature. Digital mayhem in LA.
